ovdesc.p: The SEAT.SCRIPT.FORMAT.OUTPUT template is built to check the expected and actual values obtained from OFS messages for each ENQUIRY/DEAL SLIPS reports.This application is designed to show the APPLICATION, REFERENCE ID(report name), FIELD DETAILS, LINE.AND.COLMN details of the values generated from the report and the major part comes with EXPECTED.VALUE and ACTUAL.VALUE and also the comparison RESULT.

desc.p: This field holds the Description of the purpose of the script. This should cover the every purpose for which the script is created. It is updated from the SEAT.SCRIPTS for that particular script id.(for which the Format Output record is created)
This field can have any Alphanumeric characters.

This field holds the expected values for the particular Enquiry/Deal slip report. These values are populated during the upload, when the SEAT is with 'RECORD' option. This values needs to be checked with those ACTUAL.VALUE which are populated in the 'TEST' option
This field can have any Alphabetic characters.
This field holds the Transaction id(Enquiry Report Name) for that particular script which is obtained from that SEAT.SCRIPTS record.For Deal Slip messgaes this will be the Script ID itself.
This field can have any Alphanumeric characters.

This field holds the fields names from the ENQUIRIES that are displayed in the report (when we launch the enquiry)as its value. This values are obtained from OFS.OUT.MSG has the values for this Enquiry reports.
This field can have any Alphabetic characters.

This field shows the Line and Column position for each value generated by the Enquiry/Deal slip reports. This is an mandatory field, as the EXPECTED and ACTUAl values comparison is done based on the values which is fetched from position.
This field can have any Alphabetic characters.

This field has the value as 'ERROR', when there is any mismatch between the expected and actual values in EXPECTED.VALUE and ACTUAL.VALUE multivalue fields. If there is no mismatch between the expected and actual value this field will be null.Based on this value, the OVERALL.RESULT field will be updated
This field can have any Alphabetic characters.

This field is populated with 'ERROR', when any of the RESULTS field in the multi value set is populated as 'ERROR'.Based on this field we can conclude whether there is any mismatch in the EXPECTED.VALUE and ACTUAL.VALUE fields which is updated during the 'RECORD' and 'TEST' options.
This is an NOINPUT field.This field can have any Alphanumeric characters.
This is a NOINPUT field that will get updated with value as 'NEW' when a Script is uploaded in to the Master area.

This is the unique ID to identify the records created under this file.For Enquiry reports the ID of the SEAT.SCRIPT.FORMAT.OUTPUT record will be the same as the SCRIPT ID and for the Deal Slip messages the ID will be the combination of SCRIPT ID along with the Report name.
The Format Output ID of the Enquiry Report record will be the Script ID itself E.g,SCRPT06283000132-01
The Format Output ID for the Deal Slip messages will be like FT003500DF3SDGSD1R*900*100702*20001215
This field holds the actual values for that particular Enquiry/Deal slip report. These values are populated during the upload, when SEAT is with 'TEST' option.
This field can have any Alphabetic characters.

The Application to which input is done by the script. This value is also obtained from SEAT.SCRIPTS record for that particular script id which is also the Format Output record ID.Its an mandatory field.
This field can have any Alphanumeric characters.
This field will get updated with the Date on which the SEAT.SCRIPT.FORMAT.OUTPUT record was created and uploaded to the master. This is an NOINPUT field.
Only Dates can be defined as value for this field
This field can have the value as 'Y' or null. When the value is set to 'Y' the values in the field EXPECTED.VALUE are copied to the value of ACTUAL.VALUE field.
This field can have only 'Y' or 'N'.
This field will get updated with the Date on which the SEAT.SCRIPT.FORMAT.OUTPUT reocrd was modified and uploaded to the master. This is an NOINPUT field.
Only Dates can be defined as value for this field
